   montop2000 wrote:
   > I want test the geter,should i make testcase as a inner class?


When I discovered JUnit, I would test everything : getters, setters, constructors and toString().
Looking back at it, it just increased the test cases LOC, and gave me a false sense of quality/security.

Nowadays, I just test the constructors, and that makes me use the getters. 
Good enough for me.

BTW, why would you need an inner class to do that : getters and setters are public ?!


-- Alain Ravet
